name: Burnt Palms/Gurr split tape
description: (VG.001) Very first own label release on Very Gun Records. Extremely excited to be putting out a split tape from California's Burnt Palms and Berlin's Gurr. I think both bands are out of this world and can't wait to have this up for pre-order. Both bands are offering up three brand new tracks: Burnt Palms 1. In the dark 2. Zombie Haze 3. Don't go Gurr 1. Joesph Gordon-Levitt (new recording) 2. Super tired (new recording) 3. Rollerskate Keep checking back for updates on this, pre-order and a bandcamp page should be up very soon. In the mean time check out the below: Burnt Palms debut LP Gurr demos

name: Heathers-Teenage Clothes 7" Vinyl
description: (VG.06) Described by themselves as guitar pop miserablism from los angeles, this is the fantastic debut 7" from Heathers out on Death Party Records. Brings to mind The Smiths at their most pop, think C86 jangle with a sprinkle of garage punk. One of the best debuts I've heard in a long time, put simply it's indie pop at it's best! The first 50 copies of the 300 pressed are on slick oxblood vinyl and Very Gun has been lucky enough to get hold of a few of these. First come first served. Death Party Records have also been kind enough to supply copies of a Heathers 8 track demos CD-r, this will be bundled with vinyl. The oxblood vinyl and the CD-r will be strictly limited to the first few pre-orders. *OXBLOOD VINYL AND DEMOS CD-r SOLD OUT* Listen here A. Teenage Clothes B. I Don't Wanna Be Adored Heathers is Michael Francis and Thom Lucero Limited edition 7" vinyl. 300 pressed. released 16 September 2013 both songs written by michael francis, recorded by heathers. published by dance to the radio (c) 2013 produced and mixed by paul a. rosales mastered by timothy stollenwerk, stereophonic mastering. michael: guitar/vocals thom: bass/harmonies ricky: drums

name: Gayze-Black Soul 7" vinyl EP
description: (VG.05) Really excited to be selling this brilliant slice of garage psych. Released buy the impeccable Bleeding Gold Records here's what they and the band have to say: "Born out of frustrated isolation and love of 60′s motorcycle flicks, Gayze makes its debut with Black Soul, a swirling, shaking, testimony to the raw power and swagger that seems to be lost in Garage rock these days. This is about as far from the beach as you can get so don’t even think of calling it surf. This album is a motorcycle ride through the desert to a secret party that is part Hell’s Angels gathering, part psychedelic be-in. Gayze was started as a way to pass the time by David W. Wood (leading member of the similar yet different garage outfit TEENS). Wood later enlisted the help of bassist/organist Gabriel Rudow (TEENS) and lead guitarist Cody Mauser (The Rich Hands), to help record the album. Plaintive acoustic guitar tunes are tucked in between the more raucous moments of Black Soul giving the listener a chance to breathe. Bringing a heavy dose of grit and a striking attention to detail, Gayze breathes new life into a genre that in the last few years has become too reliant on motifs and generalities." Video for Done To My Love & East Coast Dying Check out: Listen to the EP here Teens bandcamp The Rich Hands bandcamp Limited edition clear vinyl with black splatter effect. released 07 January 2013 Written: David W. Wood Performed by: David W. Wood - Vocals / Guitar / Percussion Cody Mauser - Lead Guitar Gabe Rudow - Bass / Organ Recorded at: Spooky Spaces (Idaho) Mastered by: Jose A. Saenz

name: Burnt Palms-S/T 12" vinyl
description: (VG.04) Fuzzy goodness from California. Debut self titled release from Burnt Palms. Only 100 pressed all with individual hand drawn sleeves making each one unique. Fuzzy lo-fi pop. This album will soundtrack your summer FACT! Listen to the album here: Review here: The Le Sigh review Watch Burnt Palms here Released 14 September 2012 Burnt Palms are: Christina - guitar/vocals Clara - drums/vocals Brian - bass Recorded at Brotown Sound, SanFrancisco,CA Engineered & Mixed by Gary Olson of Marlborough Farms, Brooklyn,NY Mastered by Ron Harrity of Peapod Recordings, South Portland, ME on this recording: paul towber on bass

name: The Shrills-Meltdown 12" vinyl
description: Third item for sale (VG.03) Loud, fuzzy, psych, garage doo-wop...I don't know! Call it what you want but it's gooooood! Really excited me when I first heard it. Think The Cramps locked in a garage with The Black Lips. Amazing sleeve too. Just buy it! Limited run of 500 copies on colored vinyl released 02 January 2013 Recorded 2010-2012 at The Distillery costa mesa, ca LP released via Resurrection Records Go freak out here: Cool review: Lo-pie review

name: Juan Wauters-Sanity b/w Nena 7" vinyl
description: First item for sale on Very Gun Records (VG.01): Juan Wauters is lead singer/songwriter of The Beets. Basically they are the coolest band out of NYC since The Ramones. They released two albums on Captured Tracks before their third and most recent on Hardly Art. If you don't love them already go listen and rectify that! Sanity/Nena is Juans' first solo release on vinyl. Recorded by Gary Olson at Marlborough Farms, released by Wayward Records in an edition of 500. Download code included. Artwork by Matthew Volz. Liner Notes by Jay Ruttenberg. Insert by Juan Wauters. VIDEO NOW AVAILABLE: Watch it! Listen here: For more go here: The Beets facebook The Beets on Hardly Art Here is why I first fell in love with Juan & The Beets Watch
